definition: to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on
nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The traditional needle book machine which has over a hundred years of history.
sentences.chinese: 传统的钉书机产品到今天已有一百多年的历史。

sentences.english: He wants a stapler, but she have not get one.
sentences.chinese: 他想要一个钉书机，但她没有。

sentences.english: Use a staple gun to attach the batting and fabric in place.
sentences.chinese: 用一个钉书机把绵絮和布料固定在一定的位置上。

sentences.english: Rufus: luckily, staple guns are old school.
sentences.chinese: 还好，钉书机是旧式古董啊。

sentences.english: We will also increase stock of office supplies such as paper, pens, and staplers.
sentences.chinese: 我们也将增加办公用品比如纸笔和钉书机的存货。

sentences.english: NO01, I wonder if they have any staplers in the stationery department.
sentences.chinese: 不知道他们的文具部有没有钉书机。

sentences.english: It's not like I really care. I mean, it's just a stapler .
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，那只不过是一个钉书机罢了。

sentences.english: For example, fill up the copier or printer with paper after you’re done using it.
sentences.chinese: 不如说在使用完复印机或者钉书机后装满纸盒钉。

sentences.english: May I borrow your stapler? Mine's broken.
sentences.chinese: 可以借用一下你的钉书机吗？我的坏了。

sentences.english: Nancy:You just slipped that stapler into your pocket.
sentences.chinese: 你刚才把钉书机偷偷放到你的口袋里。

sentences.english: Seal with glue. Do not use staples.
sentences.chinese: 请用胶水封口，切勿用钉书机封口。

definition: staple/also written 訂書針|订书针[ding4 shu1 zhen1]
the cap of a pen, pencil or writing brush/the sheath of a pen (made of cloth, silk or thread)
ballpoint pen/also written 圓珠筆|圆珠笔
